page.title: 04AUNSBY VILLAGE.
page.content: Aunsby never became estate-owned and its properties have changed hands without the long periods of neglect and decay with associated loss of population that has characterised some local villages.Former agricultural dwellings have become the homes of people employed in neighbouring towns. Most village events are to raise money for the restoration of the ancient church dedicated to Thomas a Becket.A most popular annual event is the brawn and ham tea on the village green.Its tiny village hall,once the school,is the venue for rummage sales and whist drives as well as being a polling station at election times.The post office operates from the front room of an ordinary house and buying a stamp is a social call.
